https://github.com/Tantares/TantaresLV

RD-58 engine. You might notice the hasty last minute addition of gimbals.

 

BEFORE being politely informed it gimballed, you were going to get boattails, will have to think if I can do this another way:

 

Woohoo! Now Buran has it engines! Btw, is a bare mount version planned?

20 hours ago, Beale said:

Awesome!

 

 

https://github.com/Tantares/TantaresLV

RD-58 engine. You might notice the hasty last minute addition of gimbals.

 

BEFORE being politely informed it gimballed, you were going to get boattails, will have to think if I can do this another way:

 

I remember that RMM and BDB have boattails that include flexible thermal blanket sections, perhaps adding a flexible segment with the same diameter between the two boattail sizes with only the fixed segment varying would help?

Tantares 27.0 For KSP 1.12.5

https://github.com/Tantares/Tantares/releases/tag/v27.0

This Update:

  • Revamped the VA.
  • New generic adapter parts.
  • Deprecated old soyuz parts.

VA
"Big-V" / The man who sold the world / Solid VA
TKS

Adapters

@Beale Is there any chance the cream-colored metallic bits of the Mir core module parts, and the various parts of the Kvant-1 module, could be changed to cream-colored thermal blankets, and the "yellow" paint option changed to grey thermal blankets? It would be more accurate to real life (as they were thermal blankets IRL) and it would give the parts more synergy with the FGB parts (and the grey thermal blankets would give the parts synergy with the Salyut parts).

Maybe, in the near future, some other misc greebles too, like the external experiments and other stuff on the exterior of Kvant-1?

Edit, pardon my sloppy editing skills, here is a photo of what I mean, with the thermal blankets highlighted -

Edited May 18 by Entr8899

@Beale Is there any chance the cream-colored metallic bits of the Mir core module parts, and the various parts of the Kvant-1 module, could be changed to cream-colored thermal blankets, and the "yellow" paint option changed to grey thermal blankets? It would be more accurate to real life (as they were thermal blankets IRL) and it would give the parts more synergy with the FGB parts (and the grey thermal blankets would give the parts synergy with the Salyut parts).

Maybe, in the near future, some other misc greebles too, like the external experiments and other stuff on the exterior of Kvant-1?
